definition: to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Why don't you protest more about the current war in the Middle East?
sentences.chinese: 为何自己不能多为近代的中东战争鸣不平呢？

sentences.english: Nothing would prevent him speaking out against injustice.
sentences.chinese: 什么也不能阻止他鸣不平。

sentences.english: He aired his grievance in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他在报纸上为自己鸣不平。

sentences.english: They murmured at the treatment they had received.
sentences.chinese: 他们对所受的待遇鸣不平。

sentences.english: They went grumbling back down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 他们去鸣不平的放弃原主张小山。

definition: to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
to be outraged by an injustice
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
feel wronged
to complain bitterly
see 打抱不平[da3 bao4 bu4 ping2]
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
to support (a cause)
to support/to back
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to cry out a grievance
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
to speak in defense of/to argue in favor of/to defend/to plead
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
